editionStmt.p: The initial version of this file was created from data kindly provided by the Ethiopic Manuscript Imaging Project directed by Steve Delamarter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: Four Gospels. Ministry of Tourism Number, T3-2-IV-1. Notes: : Record of Sale of house belonging to ደብተራ ቈጽሉ by his wife and son for 55 Ethiopian Birr to ሥላስ, in the time of Däjazmač ውቤ (1800-1867), with a long list of witnesses. (columns 1-2): Record of property of the church in 1890 EC. : List of the leaders of the church in their various assigned locations. (column 3): Record of Constitution (ንጽሕፍ ሥርዓተ ዚእሃ) of the church of Dabra Mahrat, also known as Dabra Birhan, with 77 priests፥ indicating that when a priest dies, they wait one year and then replace him. : various gult records of the church relating to various Dabtaras. King Tewodros is mentioned. : land records are interspersed among the charts, including one dated to 1818 EC. : Many more records including one dates to 1787 EC and mentioning "our king Takla Giyorgis" (1779-1800). Another mentions "our king Egwala Tseyon" (1801-1818). : Record of reconciliation, which mentions the time of Ras Wolde Selassie ዎልደ ስላሴ 1745 - 28 May 1816. : Record note of ownership of this book by Ras Wolde Selassie.
